Trial_Design.evidence: This study was designed as a prospective trial with retrospective control group

Participants.evidence: Approval was granted for study of children receiving total pancreatectomy with islet cell autotransplantation and liver transplantation ages 3–18 years.

Intervention.evidence: Magnesium sulfate bolus (50 mg/kg) followed by intravenous infusion (15 mg/kg/h) was initiated in the operating room and extended postoperatively (maximum 48 h).

Objective.evidence: to determine feasibility for implementing a high‐dose prolonged magnesium sulfate infusion for adjuvant analgesia in the pediatric intensive care unit.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcome was oral morphine equivalent per kg per day during intensive care course (maximum 7 days).

Number_Randomised.evidence: Eleven patients were enrolled between January 2020 and December 2022.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Treatment and control groups were otherwise comparable in targeted outcomes and overall adverse event profile.

Harms.evidence: There were no serious adverse events.
